alert.note: Alert for Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 2:41AM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner and Boundary. Portions of Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Ferry, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 237 AM PDT, bands of rain continue across the region. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. An additional 0.25 to 0.75 inches of rain will be possible on Tuesday with the highest amounts over North Idaho. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Colville, Chewelah, Newport, Ponderay, Moyie Springs, Kootenai, Dover, Clark Fork, East Hope, Nordman, Suncrest, Sherman Pass, Copeland, Ferry, Kettle Falls, Republic and Ione. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
